summary: This document is a chain of emails from December 2020 between Ghislaine Maxwell's legal counsel and an unspecified recipient (likely prison or detention center staff) urgently requesting daily video teleconferences (VTCs) for Maxwell to review voluminous discovery in her case. It details logistical issues, including a prior failed VTC, the suspension of in-person visits due to COVID-19, and Maxwell's placement in quarantine/isolation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated client whose legal team is urgently trying to arrange daily video conferences to review discovery documents for her upcoming case. She is identified as inmate 02879-509 and is in quarantine/isolation.

events.title: Failed VTC with Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A video teleconference was arranged for Ghislaine Maxwell but failed due to audio problems.

events.title: Urgent VTC Requests for Case Preparation
events.description: Maxwell's legal counsel makes repeated, urgent requests for daily video conferences to review millions of discovery documents ahead of filing deadlines, citing suspended in-person visits due to COVID-19.

locations: West 19th Street office (Law Offices, closed remotely)
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, implied location for Maxwell)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team was urgently seeking daily video conferences (VTCs) from 12:30-3:30 PM on weekdays in December 2020 to review case discovery.
Maxwell was in quarantine/isolation (East SHU) at the MDC, with in-person legal visits suspended due to a COVID-19 outbreak at the facility.
The case involved 'voluminous discovery,' with a noted production of 1.2 million documents, creating an imperative need for attorney-client contact.
A prior VTC attempt on August 18, 2020, had failed due to technical audio problems.
The correspondence shows the logistical challenges Maxwell's defense faced in preparing for her legal proceedings while she was in restrictive custody.
